value.title: Build the intelligent edge with Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions or about Azure IoT, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
topItems.excerpt: Explain the essential characteristics of the IoT Edge and the functionality of the IoT Edge components (modules, runtime, and cloud interface). Characterize the types of problems that you can solve with IoT Edge.  Describe how the elements of IoT Edge can be combined to solve the problem of deploying IoT applications in the cloud.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge

topItems.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device
topItems.excerpt: Deploy a pre-built temperature simulator module to the edge using a container. The pre-built module will be deployed to an IoT edge device. You will check that the module was successfully created and deployed to the edge. You will view the simulated data from the deployed module.

images.title: Deploy a prebuilt module to the Edge device

topItems.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
topItems.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

images.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway

value.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
value.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.

images.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service

value.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
value.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from the "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you control a refrigerated truck. This module adds continuous data export to both Blob storage, and an Event Hub. Then, a Power BI app is built to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

images.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app

value.title: Create your first route finding app with Azure Maps
value.excerpt: Learn about writing code to interact with Azure Maps. Develop and test a fun app to find the best route for a truck, car, or bicycle. The route is from the west coast of the USA, to the east coast. You will see how routes change based on vehicle. And, for trucks, how routes vary if the contents are hazardous. You will get the chance to add in your own locations.

images.title: Create your first route finding app with Azure Maps

value.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

images.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics

value.title: Connecting IoT devices to Cognitive Services using Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Create and deploy an Azure function to make a language translation IoT device. The function will use Cognitive Speech Service. Your device will record a voice in a foreign language and convert the speech to a target language.

images.title: Connecting IoT devices to Cognitive Services using Azure Functions

value.title: Identify Exceptions with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: This module will focus on the proactive detection of anomalies in the IoT device telemetry.  Additionally, this module will cover the customization of the Connected Field Service components to handle different telemetry from the device and options for storing detail data for future analysis.

value.title: Image Classification using Azure Sphere
value.excerpt: Implement a neural network model for performing real-time image classification on a secured, internet-connected microcontroller-based device (Azure Sphere). Describe the components and steps for implementing a pre-trained image classification model on Azure Sphere.

images.title: Image Classification using Azure Sphere

value.title: Implement CICD for IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Define a solution for smoke testing for virtual IoT Edge devices. Your solution will employ a CI/CD (Continuous Integration/ Continuous Deployment) strategy using Azure DevOps, Azure Pipelines, and Azure Application Insights on a Kubernetes cluster.

images.title: Implement CICD for IoT Edge

value.title: Introduction to Azure Sphere
value.excerpt: Determine the types of business problems that can be solved using Azure Sphere. Explain the capabilities and the components (microcontroller unit, operating system, cloud-based security service) for the Azure Sphere. Describe how the components provide a secure platform to develop, deploy, and maintain secure internet connected IoT solutions.

images.title: Introduction to Azure Sphere

value.title: Introduction to Azure Functions for IoT
value.excerpt: Assess the characteristics of Azure Functions for IoT. Describe the function of triggers and bindings and show how you combine them to create a scalable IoT solution. Describe the benefits of using cloud infrastructure to rapidly deploy IoT applications with Azure Functions.

images.title: Introduction to Azure Functions for IoT

value.title: Introduction to MLOps for IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Analyze the significance of MLOps in the development and deployment of machine learning models for IoT Edge. Describe the components of the MLOps pipeline and show how you can combine them to create models that can be retrained automatically for IoT Edge devices.

images.title: Introduction to MLOps for IoT Edge

value.title: Introduction to Azure IoT
value.excerpt: Explain the significance of Azure IoT and the problems it solves. Describe Azure IoT components and explain how you combine them to solve IoT solutions, which create value for enterprises.

images.title: Introduction to Azure IoT

value.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API
value.excerpt: The IoT Central REST API lets you manage applications programmatically. For example, you can add device templates, create devices, set device properties, send commands to devices, and manage data exports.

images.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API

value.title: Manage your Azure IoT Hub with alerts and metrics
value.excerpt: Learn about metrics, alerts, diagnostics, and logs. Create an Azure IoT Hub, an app to send vibration telemetry, and then create and test some metrics and alerts.

images.title: Manage your Azure IoT Hub with alerts and metrics

value.title: Monitor and manage your coffee machine with Azure IoT Central
value.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure IoT Central application to monitor and manage an IoT device.

images.title: Monitor and manage your coffee machine with Azure IoT Central

value.title: Register and manage customer devices with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: This module will focus on IoT Device registration and monitoring using the Connected Field Service solution including device registration (physical and non-physical), working with device twins, and streamlining device management and interactions.

images.title: Register and manage customer devices with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT

value.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.

images.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub

value.title: Remotely monitor and service customer equipment with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: This module will focus on the end-to-end process of remotely monitoring IoT enabled devices using the Connected Field Service solution including device registration, working with alerts, and designing processes to take specific actions.

images.title: Remotely monitor and service customer equipment with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
